name: Fishing for a Future
title: Smallest Fisheries Production
description: In 2022, Eswatini produced only 165 metric tons of fish, marking one of the lowest fisheries productions globally.

name: HIV Battlefront
title: High HIV Prevalence
description: In 2022, 25.9% of Eswatini's population aged 15-49 were living with HIV, one of the highest rates worldwide. However, 95% of those affected received antiretroviral therapy, showcasing significant healthcare efforts.

name: Youth at Risk
title: HIV Incidence Among Youth
description: In 2022, the incidence of HIV among Eswatini's youth aged 15-24 was 7.83 per 1,000 uninfected individuals, highlighting a critical area for intervention.

name: Unemployment Challenge
title: High Unemployment Rates
description: In 2021, Eswatini faced a total unemployment rate of 34.15%, with male unemployment at 32.79% and female unemployment at 44.75% among those with intermediate education.

name: Early Marriage Decline
title: Lowest Early Marriage Rates
description: In 2022, only 0.1% of women aged 20-24 in Eswatini were married by age 15, reflecting a positive trend towards delaying marriage.

name: Regional Trade Leader
title: High Export to Sub-Saharan Africa
description: In 2023, 90.44% of Eswatini's merchandise exports were directed to low- and middle-income economies in Sub-Saharan Africa, indicating strong regional trade ties.
